Articles.Content:
Alrighty so I'm not entirely sure if this is the correct place to be posting something like this, but I wanted to talk about the Grand Tour mission I'm currently undertaking. The gist is to land on every celestial body that can be landed on without returning to Kerbin. I see this as something of a holy grail of KSP missions, a real elite level undertaking.

I've been streaming it so far at my twitch channel, from midnight to 4am UTC time.

I've just left Moho for Eve, so I've only just started. Is there much interest for me detailing the mission thus far, and as it progresses, or should I just leave the stream link here?
I think this goes here, but yeah, Grand Tours are pretty much always interesting.
Ah, thanks, I'll go and put it there instead!
There is a spot for sharing videos of KSP, and your thread is now there.

Here's my single launch, no refuel, stock grand tour ship that includes a reusable lander for all planets except Eve (Eve is a separate one time use lander), including Tylo with reusable rover and reusable probes (you're not going to land on a planet without first sending an unmanned probe, are you?). I finished the mission with fuel to spare.
